text: hi I'm Julia Moscone today we're making
classic cranberry sauce this can be made
in about 15 minutes add the cranberries
the water sugar and salt all together
when all the ingredients are in the pot
turn on the stove and turn the heat to
medium bring the mixture to a boil when
it starts to bubble lower the heat to a
simmer let it cook like this for at
least 10 minutes until the cranberries
start to burst it needs to cook for at
least 10 minutes for the pectin to be
released so that it will gel later on
once the cranberry sauce is finished
cooking remove the pan from the heat
carefully stir in orange juice or liquor
if you're using this adds an extra layer
of flavor that is really great against
stuffing and Turkey cover the mixture
and chill it once it's cold it will gel
you can store it in an airtight
container like this for up to a week
once chilled you can add pecans if
you're using them stir the nuts into the
cooled mixture a few hours before
serving
syrup cranberry sauce on the side and
save some for sandwiches the day after
Thanksgiving
Oh
